  • The Lang code is greater than 3 letters for Track Title Lang in Xml file

name: 1.4 - Project Main Artist as a Project Participant - #5: User creates a Project with multiple Project Participants via Bulk Input (not including Main Artist)

name: 1.4 - Multiple Repertoire Owner - #6 Product and Track Metadata created using Product (DDEX) XML import type with the provided Rep. Owner
expected_result: • Product and Tracks Metadata from the (DDEX) XML file will be created with the provided Rep. Owner for products and tracks respectively. After they have been successfully imported into GRAS proper, the products and tracks should reflect the correct repertoire owner.
preconditions:
• User has permission to access GRAS Lite System
  • User has basic user permission
  • Product (DDEX)

name: 1.4 - Product class - 1 #8 Product created using (DDEX) XML import type doesn’t support  Product Class field and parses it to music by default
expected_result: • If the XML has only SoundRecording nodes, the product will be created using Music product class. If the XML has only Video nodes, the product will be created using Video product class. If there is a mix, an error will be thrown.
preconditions:
• User has permission to access GRAS Lite System
  • User has BASIC_USER permission
  • Product (DDEX) XML

name: Export Audio Master / Converted Audio to local file Share without Export Unapproved Audio Master Permission - V4
expected_result: Successful

name: 1.4 - Product class - #7 CSV import understands Product Class field and correctly parses it
expected_result: • The products from the CSV file will be created with the provided product class if it is either Music or Movies. If it is empty, or if some other value has been provided, the product will be created using the Music product class by default, and an appropriate warning message will be shown.
preconditions:
• User has permission to access GRAS Lite System
  • User has BASIC_USER permission
  • Product (CSV)

  • System discards any duplicates
  • “Prod. Main Artist” box and “Include on Product” box are checked for the Main Artist Participant

name: 16 Bit WAV Intergration: Unlink the tracks
expected_result:
•   16 bit delete message is sent to EOM

  • It is also possible to verify by creating a DPSO ticket: 
    1.  Create a DPSO ticket as below (here’s a ticket as an example) and assign to “DPS Order Management”              https://jira.smedigitalapps.com/jira/browse/DPSO-26792
    2. Don't put the DPSO JIRA ticket into the Betabase JIRA ticket field, rather put it in the Input field. 
    3. While waiting for a response to the DPSO ticket, mark your test as 'Pending'. 
    4. Update it when you get your DPSO response.
  • Please enter the action (Un-register or Un-link) at the beginning of the 'Input' field
  • Note: system will display an 'N' rather than the 16 as shown in the image.
preconditions: • Product is track linked to DDP assets OR 16 bit WAV assets

name: 16 Bit WAV Intergration: Un-register/Unlink 16 bit WAV assets (b) NOT READY FOR TESTING
expected_result:
•   16 bit delete message is NOT sent to EOM

  • It is also possible to verify by creating a DPSO ticket: 
    1.  Create a DPSO ticket as below (here’s a ticket as an example) and assign to “DPS Order Management”              https://jira.smedigitalapps.com/jira/browse/DPSO-26792
    2. Don't put the DPSO JIRA ticket into the Betabase JIRA ticket field, rather put it in the Input field. 
    3. While waiting for a response to the DPSO ticket, mark your test as 'Pending'. 
    4. Update it when you get your DPSO response.
  • Please enter the action (Un-register or Un-link) at the beginning of the 'Input' field
preconditions:
• Product with registered DDP master OR linked DDP (full master/side)

  • Product also has registered 16 bit WAV master OR linked 16 bit WAV (full master/side)

name: 16 Bit WAV Intergration: Un-register/Unlink DDP assets (b) NOT READY FOR TESTING
expected_result:
•   16 bit delete message is NOT sent to EOM

  • It is also possible to verify by creating a DPSO ticket: 
    1.  Create a DPSO ticket as below (here’s a ticket as an example) and assign to “DPS Order Management”              https://jira.smedigitalapps.com/jira/browse/DPSO-26792
    2. Don't put the DPSO JIRA ticket into the Betabase JIRA ticket field, rather put it in the Input field. 
    3. While waiting for a response to the DPSO ticket, mark your test as 'Pending'. 
    4. Update it when you get your DPSO response.
  • Please enter the action (Un-register or Un-link) at the beginning of the 'Input' field
preconditions:
• Product with registered DDP master OR linked DDP (full master/side)

  • Product also has registered 16 bit WAV master OR linked 16 bit WAV (full master/side)
